content:
Sure, here are a few more exciting outdoor activities that you might enjoy in St Albans and the surrounding area:

1. Go Ape: Go Ape is a treetop adventure course with zip lines, rope bridges, and other obstacles. The course is located at the beautiful, 400-acre Alexandra Park in nearby Hemel Hempstead.

2. Outdoor Cinema: St Albans Film Festival hosts outdoor cinema events during the summer months. The films are screened in the beautiful surroundings of the Cathedral grounds, and moviegoers are encouraged to bring picnics, blankets, and chairs.

3. Climbing Wall: The XC Centre in Hemel Hempstead has a giant indoor climbing wall that's perfect for all skill levels, from beginner to expert. The centre also has an ice-skating rink, laser tag, and soft play area.

4. Kayaking: Just a few miles outside of St Albans, Action Watersports has kayaking and paddleboarding on their lake, as well as a giant inflatable "Wibit" aqua park for kids and adults.

5. Hiking: The Chilterns Hills, located a short drive from St Albans, offer miles of hiking trails through beautiful countryside, pretty villages, and historic sites such as Ivinghoe Beacon and Ashridge Estate.

Hopefully, one of these activities sparks your interest and you can enjoy the great outdoors in St Albans in a more exciting way!
